> To Kamo-san.
> Did you visit Satsuma? 
> I have not gone there.
> (Ichido wa Itte mitai desu. Shikashi nakanaka kikai
> ga arimasen.)


I went there and spent the day walking along some
famous spots including, but not limited to, Saigo
Takamori and his comrades (Shiroyama! "Kogun funto /
kakomi wo yabutte kaeru / Ippyaku no ritei (...)" wo
omoidashimashita). Saw also the tomb of Togo
Heihachiro.


> I have visited to Kumamoto and Nagasaki near
> Satsuma. 
> Didn't you go to Kumamoto Castle? 


Unfortunately, I had no time to go to Higo this time
-_- Went to Nagasaki, though.



> At the teenage time, I believed that Kirino Toshiaki
> (as Nakamura 
> Hanjirou) was handsome. 
> And his photograph was seen here and I was
> disappointed very much. 
> lol
> 
>
http://www.dokidoki.ne.jp/home2/quwatoro/bakumatu/kirino.html


Well, WAY better than Takasugi ^^;;;

 
> I think that Yoshida Shoin is the teacher of an
> ideal. 


I agree. A superb scholar with a natural talent for
teaching.


> Takasugi Shinsaku, Yoshida Toshimaro, and Kusaka
> Genzui are the 
> excellent students to whom Yoshida Shoin was looking
> forward to the 
> future. 


Went to their graves too. It was surprisingly near to
Yoshida Shoin's birthplace.


> >(ano Takasugi wa chotto kakko yoku nai desu ^^;;;)
> 
> Takasugi Shinsaku is not handsome.^^;;; 



Saw a picture with him and other two boys (forgot who
they were ^^;;;;) where he wasn't so bad looking.
Also, his picture in bogu isn't *that* bad.


> His face was very long. 
> When he rode on a horse and walked along a town,
> people teased him, 
> saying "He is wearing the face of a horse rather
> than the horse." 
> However, he was liked very much by women^_^


That's to see that taste isn't something that can be
understood (laughs).



> By the way, don't you know the present appearance of
> Takasugi house? 
> I looked at the news to which that is closed several
> months ago. 
> (The posterity of Takasugi had answered that it
> became impossible to 
> preserve it.) 


I went to Takasugi's house and indeed it was closed.
There was a sign there warning that it was uncertain
whether it would be reopen for general visitation
again.

Meanwhile, I guess all the other houses are still
open. Went to Katsura Kogoro's house, Yoshida Shoin's
house (including Shokason-juku) and Ito Hirobumi's
house.



 
> >And last, but not least, read "Dandara", by Akana
> Shu.
> >Liked very much the drawing. Quite cool.
> 
> Akana Shu is famous as the author of Anime "YUGO".
> Although I counted on "Dandara" very much, it is
> interrupted now. 
> 
> (Totemo zannen desu.)-_-


Indeed -_-



=====
Serizawa Kamo

"I am the bone of my sword.
    Steel is my body,and fire is my blood.
  I have created over a thousand blades.
       Unknown to Death.
   Nor known to Life.
Have withstood pain to create many weapons.
     Yet, those hands will never hold anyting.
         So as I pray, unlimited blade works."

                               (Fate/Stay Night)
